anime.description: In the third movie, the classical Japan-Europe match becomes intercontinental. This time they arrange a world cup with 4 teams: Japan, USA, "All Europe", and "All South America". In the first match, Japan easily defeats the USA 3:0 and in the second match Europe loses 2:3 against South America. In the final round S.A. shows their "soccer cyborg" Carlos Santana, a more than supreme player who seems to be undefeatable. All their classical tricks like Hyugas "Tiger Shot" or Tsubasas "Top Spin" seem to be totally worthless, but in a hard and spectacular match the Japanese learn more and more to play in unison and finally they get the win. Source: ANN Note: While it is in fact the fourth movie, in some countries this movie was released and named the third movie.

tag.name: association football
tag.description: Football is a sport that involves kicking a ball in order to score a goal, while the other team tries to stop you by kicking the ball in the other direction to score a goal of their own. In the United States, this sport is known as soccer; the inappropriately titled "American" football (which in fact is played with the egg-shaped "ball" being carried around) is some kind of rugby for babies.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

character.name: Oozora Tsubasa
character.description: A prodigious soccer player, Tsubasa dreams of one day winning the FIFA World Cup for Japan. His position is midfielder, usually wearing jersey #10. (Wikipedia)

character.name: Wakabayashi Genzou
character.description: Wakabayashi Genzou is an extroardinary goalkeeper who can catch almost anything thrown at him. Not many shots can come past Genzou. A charismatic guy, Genzou is also loyal to his friends and he is firm with his decisions. Genzou always keeps his feelings to himself and people close to him as seen in Shin Captain Tsubasa, when he`s willingly criticize his teammates` performance in order to make them realize that football in Europe is different than what they play in Japan. His actions caused a lot of Japanese players to dislike him and Genzou only told Tsubasa his true intentions. From early childhood, he has aimed to be the best goalkeeper in the world. He tended to be selfish, and brag about his skills before he met and played a couple of games against Tsubasa. After his match against Tsubasa, he has learned to enjoy the game with his other teammates.

character.name: Hyuuga Kojirou
character.description: To help his family, Hyuuga Kojirou wants to be a professional player, an ace striker. His devotion to football and his persistence to shoot the goal is outstanding. He was both Tsubasa`s and Genzou`s top rival. A great guy, Hyuuga is not only strong, he is also tough but at the same time caring. Can be a bit impulsive at times, though. He was once famous because of his roughness and many players were scared of him. But, Hyuuga is actually a kind boy who cares about his family and friends. In the World Youth series, Hyuuga was one of the 7 players to be excluded from the Japanese National team after they lost 3 group matches with Real Japan 7 (R.J.7). Determined to get back into the team, Hyuuga developed a new shot, the Raijuu shot, a shot which is a bit similar to Tsubasa`s Drive Shoot, except that Hyuuga`s Raijuu Shot is a ground shot that will curve upward, unlike Tsubasa`s Drive Shooter which will go up then curve downward.

character.name: Wakashimazu Ken
character.description: The "Karate Keeper", Wakashimazu Ken is a goalkeeper on par with http://anidb.net/ch2084 [Wakabayashi Genzou], but more offense-oriented. As his nickname implies, he is an expert karateka since his father is the master of a dojo. His father originally disapproved his efforts to become a footballer and his opposition to become the heir of the dojo. Wakashimazu became interested in football when http://anidb.net/ch8344 [Hyuuga Kojirou] invited him to join the Meiwa team after being impressed by his abilities in a one-on-one duel that Wakashimazu lost. Since then, they are close friends. Despite being an excellent goalkeeper, he originally was a forward and only became goalkeeper because Meiwa didn`t have competent goalkeepers. A reliable partner of Hyuga while in the Meiwa and Toho teams, he and Wakabayashi regularly alternate in the goalkeeper position with the Japanese team.

character.name: Souda Makoto
character.description: Makoto Soda is a fearsome defender who knows how to injure people with tackles without the referee`s knowledge. He is quite fast and he tends to put effects on his balls when he passes or shoots.

character.name: Hefner
character.description: The main German goalkeeper during the original http://anidb.net/a505 [Captain Tsubasa] TV series and Europe goalkeeper in the films http://anidb.net/a2337 [Captain Tsubasa: Europa Daikessen], http://anidb.net/a3560 [Captain Tsubasa: Ayaushi! Zen Nippon Jr.] and http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup]. He is later replaced by Deuter Müller, his manga counterpart, in http://anidb.net/a508 [the 2001 TV series].

character.name: Aoba Yayoi
character.description: A friend of http://anidb.net/ch2083 [Oozora Tsubasa], her close relationship with him initially causes the jealousy of http://anidb.net/ch30218 [Nakazawa Sanae]. In reality, Yayoi`s affections are for http://anidb.net/ch30221 [Misugi Jun].

character.name: Sugimoto Kumi
character.description: A manager of the Nankatsu middle school football team, during the middle school arc of the Captain Tsubasa series, Kumi true interest is not in football but in http://anidb.net/ch2083 [Oozora Tsubasa] for whom she has a crush on. While a true rival of http://anidb.net/ch30218 [Nakazawa Sanae], Tsubasa already has someone he likes.

character.name: Fujisawa Yoshiko
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch80208 [Matsuyama Hikaru]`s love interest during the middle school arc of the Captain Tsubasa series until she hast to leave Japan. She is the one that gives Matsuyame his signature headband. Later in the series she becomes her girlfriend and eventually her fiancée.

character.name: Ramon Victorino
character.description: The captain of Uruguay in the Captain Tsubasa series. His first appearance in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup] differs from the manga and other adaptations as he hadn`t appeared in the canon story at that point.

character.name: Gonzales
character.description: The imposing goalkeeper of the South American team in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup].

character.name: Carlos Santana
character.description: The "Soccer Cyborg", an extremely talented forward easily on par with http://anidb.net/ch80224 [Karl-Heinz Schneider]. He is cold and ruthless at first due to a very rough childhood until meeting http://anidb.net/ch2083 [Oozora Tsubasa], which allows him to regain his love for football. His appearance in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup] is very different from the manga and other anime adaptations since he didn`t appear in the canon story until years later.

character.name: Juan Diaz
character.description: A talented midfielder and captain or Argentina during the Captain Tsubasa series. His appearance in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup] is different from the manga and other anime adaptations since he hadn`t appeared in the canon story at that point.

character.name: Sylvester Luke
character.description: The boisterous and brash captain of the USA in http://anidb.net/a3561 [Captain Tsubasa: Sekai Daikessen!! Jr. World Cup]. He plays as a forward.

character.name: Announcer
character.description: The ubiquitous voice that narrates most matches during the Captain Tsubasa series.
